title: Fairly heavy showers expected in some places today
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Southern province today (09).

title: Indonesia ready to shelter Palestinians impacted by war in Gaza
byline: Indonesia is ready to temporarily shelter Palestinians impacted by the war in Gaza, President Prabowo Subianto said in a statement on Wednesday, as he started his trip to the Middle East region and Turkey.

title: Stocks slide again as US forges ahead with 104% tariffs on China
byline: The United States said on Tuesday that 104% duties on imports from China will take effect shortly after midnight, even as the administration of President Donald Trump moved to quickly start talks with other trading partners targeted by sweeping tariffs.

title: Urban schools face severe A/L teacher shortage?
byline: The Ceylon Teachers’ Union (CTU) raised alarm over a critical shortage of teachers for the G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) in schools across the country, particularly in urban national schools.

title: Roof collapses at a Dominican Republic nightclub, killing at least 79 people
byline: The roof of an iconic nightclub in the Dominican capital collapsed early Tuesday during a merengue concert attended by politicians, athletes and others, leaving at least 79 people dead and 160 injured, authorities said.

title: Major currencies strengthen against US Dollar despite tariff hikes, says Fitch
byline: Despite a significant rise in US tariffs, most major global currencies have appreciated against the US dollar since the start of the year, according to Fitch Ratings’ latest FX Market Monitor.

title: Tense standoff at Weligama apparel factory over unpaid New Year bonus
byline: A tense situation was reported at a privately-owned apparel factory in Udukawa, Weligama last night (April 8), after employees staged a protest against the management’s decision to withhold the Sinhala and Tamil New Year bonus.

title: Keheliya arrives at CID
byline: Former Minister of Health Keheliya Rambukwella has arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to record a statement.

title: Over 304kg of Kerala cannabis seized in Kilinochchi
byline: An individual has been arrested for the possession of over 304kg of Kerala cannabis valued at Rs. 121 million in Kilinochchi.

title: Relief measures underway for SMEs despite ‘Parate’ law deadline ending: Finance Ministry
byline: With the expiration of the extension granted for ‘Parate’ execution on March 31, 2025, the Government of Sri Lanka remains steadfast in its commitment to facilitate the revitalization of Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs), the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development says.

title: Namal Rajapaksa meets Indian PM Modi
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa met with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday (08).

title: Appeal applications on Grade 06 admissions accepted online from today
byline: Appeal applications for Grade 6 student admissions, based on the results of the 2024 Grade 5 Scholarship Examination, will be accepted online starting today (09), the Ministry of Education has announced.

title: PM Harini gives timeline on drafting Sri Lanka’s new constitution
byline: The present government has two urgent priorities before commencing the process of formulating a new constitution for the country, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said in Parliament today.

title: India central bank cuts rates, changes stance to ‘accommodative’ as US tariffs add to growth risks
byline: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) lowered its key repo rate on Wednesday for a second consecutive time and changed its monetary policy stance signalling room for more cuts ahead, as it seeks to boost the sluggish economy, which is facing further pressure from U.S. tariffs.

title: Trump administration moves to restore some terminated foreign aid programs: Report
byline: President Donald Trump’s administration on Tuesday moved to reinstate at least six recently canceled U.S. foreign aid programs for emergency food assistance, six sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

title: LG Polls: 13 candidates arrested for violating election laws
byline: A total of 13 candidates contesting the upcoming Local Government Election have been arrested for flouting election laws since 3 March, Police said.

title: President launches National Anti-Corruption Action Plan
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake ceremonially launched the ‘National Anti-Corruption Action Plan 2025-2029’ today (09).

title: CID arrests former Chairman of Kataragama Pradeshiya Sabha
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has arrested the former Chairman of the Kataragama Pradeshiya Sabha, Asoka Wickremasinghe.

title: Trump says US will soon announce tariff on pharmaceutical imports
byline: President Donald Trump on Tuesday (Apr 8) said the United States will soon announce a “major” tariff on pharmaceutical imports.

title: ADB projects Sri Lanka’s economic growth at 3.9 % in 2025
byline: Sri Lanka’s economy is projected to grow by 3.9% in the current fiscal year, according to the Asian Development Bank.

title: Police discover 200 kg of Kerala cannabis in lorry transporting fish
byline: Two individuals have been apprehended while transporting a stock of Kerala cannabis valued at over Rs. 55 million in a lorry.

title: Section of Rampart Street in Galle Fort caves in
byline: A section of the Rampart Street in the historic Galle Fort, a famous tourist attraction, has caved-in.

title: Court orders to exhume remains of youth who died under Welikada Police custody
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the Colombo Chief Judicial Medical Officer (JMO) to exhume the remains of the youth who died while in the custody of Welikada Police.

title: Ex-Auditor General says state officials also involved in corruption
byline: Government servants are also partly responsible for some of the corruption reported within state institutions, says outgoing Auditor General Chulantha Wickramaratne.

title: Fairer trade dynamic can fuel economic growth, job creation – US Ambassador
byline: A fairer trade dynamic can fuel economic growth and job creation for both Sri Lanka and the United States, says US Ambassador to Sri Lanka Julie Chung.

title: Titanic scan reveals ground-breaking details of ship’s final hours
byline: A detailed analysis of a full-sized digital scan of the Titanic has revealed new insight into the doomed liner’s final hours.

title: President to meet all party leaders tomorrow to discuss US tariffs impact
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will meet all party leaders tomorrow (April 10) to discuss the impact of the “unusual” US Tariffs imposed on Sri Lanka’s exports, the Leader of the House, Minister Bimal Rathnayake said.

title: Ex-State Minister Viyalendran released after meeting bail conditions
byline: Former State Minister Sathasivam Viyalendran, who was arrested and remanded over bribery charges, has been released after meeting his bail conditions.

title: Samantha Ranasinghe to fill Kosala Nuwan’s MP seat
byline: The Election Commission has announced that Samantha Ranasinghe of the National People’s Power (NPP) has been elected as a Member of Parliament to fill the vacancy created by the passing of NPP Kegalle District MP, Kosala Nuwan Jayaweera.

title: Sri Lanka, Australia reaffirm commitment to deepening defence ties
byline: Sri Lanka and Australia have reaffirmed the commitment to deepening defence ties and exploring new avenues for cooperation in areas such as maritime domain awareness (MDA), training exchanges and capacity-building initiatives. NORE..

title: Ex-Minister Mervyn Silva and 3 others further remanded
byline: Former Minister Mervyn Silva, who was arrested and remanded for allegedly selling a plot of state-owned land in Kiribathgoda to a private party by forging documents, has been further remanded.

title: Sri Lanka launches new National Anti-Corruption Action Plan
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has officially launched the National Anti-Corruption Action Plan (NACAP) 2025-2029 today, as a strategic initiative to reaffirm the country’s commitment to strengthening governance, enhancing transparency, and reinforcing the rule of law.

title: China to impose 84% tariffs on US goods from Apr 10, up from 34%
byline: China will impose 84 per cent tariffs on US goods from Thursday (Apr 10), up from the 34 per cent previously announced, the finance ministry said on Wednesday.

title: Sun directly over parts of Sri Lanka tomorrow
byline: The Department of Meteorology announced that on the apparent northward relative motion of the sun, it is going to be directly over the latitudes of Sri Lanka during April 05 to April 14 this year.

title: Dilith ‘deeply grateful’ for all-party conference on US tariffs
byline: Leader of the ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ alliance, Parliamentarian Dilith Jayaweera has expressed his appreciation towards President and the Government for responding positively to his request for an all-party conference on the tariffs imposed by the US on Sri Lankan exports.

title: Prevention of corruption will not be passed on to next generation – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized that since assuming office, the current government has taken decisive steps to free the process of combating bribery and corruption from political interference.

title: Constable attached to State Intelligence Service arrested
byline: A Police Constable (PC) attached to the State Intelligence Service (SIS) has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: China denies significant numbers of its citizens are fighting for Russia in Ukraine
byline: Ukraine’s claim that significant numbers of Chinese nationals are fighting for Russia’s invading army is “totally unfounded,” a Beijing official said Wednesday, as the U.S. strives to secure a ceasefire in the more than three-year war.

title: Health officials urge caution as mosquito-borne diseases on the rise in Sri Lanka
byline: Health officials urge the public to remain vigilant and seek immediate medical attention if they experience symptoms linked to mosquito-borne diseases, as cases of Chikungunya, dengue, and malaria are back on the rise in Sri Lanka.
